body:
Ooh, that's a new one. Since we don't have any compiled code, this is likely a bug in something else. Hunches:
- sqlite
- select

Is this repeatable?

Yep, just not everytime (the worst!):

``` bash
In [19]:
Do you really want to exit ([y]/n)? y
python(75852,0x7fff7c665000) malloc: *** error for object 0x10bfeb668: incorrect checksum for freed object - object was probably modified after being freed.
*** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug
[1]    75852 abort      ipython
```

Stack trace here: http://gist.github.com/b995b5dc6d440eb52cea4397b497dc98
And only happening in ipython terminal, btw.
Stack trace points to HDF5 being the culprit. Do you have HDF5 files open when you are exiting?
didn't open HDF5 files manually since long. Unless pd.read_hdf() somehow forgets to close down the file? Will check...

Here's another stack trace. This time I just played a bit with astropy.coordinates, nothing with HDF5 at all:
https://gist.github.com/d065bd61378f4b0d30ce5f2fe653799d

Interesting, I just found this open issue.

I get the same issue with the QT Console on FreeBSD 11.0-RELEASE. I wouldn't put it past a configuration error, as I rebuilt everything (including Python 3.4 and Qt5) from source (the python35 binary pkg seems to be SIGBUSing too, so I did a source build to get debug info).

The ResourceWarnings occur at startup; I can't seem to silence them, and they're probably unrelated (newly introduced 3.5 sanity checks maybe?). Once IPython is running it seems ok (are there some exercises/thrash-tests I can run?). The SIGBUS happens upon shutdown.

I was actually setting this up for a friend (I'll point him at this issue) - Python/Jupyter have been on my own "that would be a really good idea to learn" todo list for a while but I'm not there yet, so I have no idea what I'm doing. :P Neither of us are especially experienced at GDB but happy to try stuff.

```
$ gdb --args python3.5 `which jupyter-qtconsole`
GNU gdb 6.1.1 [FreeBSD]
Copyright 2004 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
GDB is free software, covered by the GNU General Public License, and you are
welcome to change it and/or distribute copies of it under certain conditions.
Type "show copying" to see the conditions.
There is absolutely no warranty for GDB.  Type "show warranty" for details.
This GDB was configured as "amd64-marcel-freebsd"...
(gdb) run
Starting program: /usr/local/bin/python3.5 /usr/local/bin/jupyter-qtconsole
[New LWP 101640]
[New Thread 801e16000 (LWP 101640/python3.5)]
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/qtconsole/qt_loaders.py:126: ResourceWarning: unclosed file <_io.BufferedReader name='/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/PyQt5/QtCore.so'>
  imp.find_module('QtCore', mod.__path__)
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/qtconsole/qt_loaders.py:127: ResourceWarning: unclosed file <_io.BufferedReader name='/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/PyQt5/QtGui.so'>
  imp.find_module('QtGui', mod.__path__)
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/qtconsole/qt_loaders.py:128: ResourceWarning: unclosed file <_io.BufferedReader name='/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/PyQt5/QtSvg.so'>
  imp.find_module('QtSvg', mod.__path__)
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/qtconsole/qt_loaders.py:131: ResourceWarning: unclosed file <_io.BufferedReader name='/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/PyQt5/QtWidgets.so'>
  imp.find_module('QtWidgets', mod.__path__)
warning: Lowest section in /usr/local/lib/libicudata.so.57 is .hash at 0000000000000120
[New Thread 8106bdc00 (LWP 101860/python3.5)]

Program received signal SIGBUS, Bus error.
[Switching to Thread 801e16000 (LWP 101640/python3.5)]

52          if (pySelf && ((pyqtWrapperType *)Py_TYPE(pySelf))->metaobject)
Current language:  auto; currently c++
```
